Today, we recognize The LD Expert Stephanie Tsapakis, M. A., WDT and Chelsea DiMarzio, M. A. CCC-SLP, WDP as a Civics for Everyone Heroesbecause they dont just support students with learning differences, they amplify them.  https://www.ldexpert.org/ In a world where too many learners are underestimated or overlooked, The LD Expert is giving students the tools - and the belief - to step forward, speak up, and lead. Using their expertise in learning disabilities, they work to empower students with strategies for comprehension and communication and have a deep commitment to making civic learning truly accessible. Their services ensure that students with learning differences receive the necessary support to actively engage in civic education by enhancing their communication skills, reading abilities, and participation in classroom discussions. Meet BRIs 2025 Student Fellow, Brianna Blair! Brianna is a high school junior from Goodyear, Arizona. She is very excited to be a BRI Student Fellow! With a passion for civic education, she believes in increasing representation in government and politics. She founded a youth organization, HerGov, to increase the number of young women entering the public policy sphere. Learn more about BRI's Student Fellowship!  https://bit.ly/3f2q66h

Interested in learning about our approach to teaching civics? Chief Program Officer Stan Swim explores how we seek to teach it in a way that is effective, unique, and relevant to students and educators today. Instead of focusing solely on the structure and function of government, BRI teaches young people to engage in the institutions of civil society, like businesses, charities, and community groups, to solve problems and pursue opportunities. Watch the video today!  https://lnkd.in/e8CMY-jj

Today, June 6, marks the anniversary of Allied forces landing in Northern France, beginning what they hoped would bring about the destruction of the German war machine, the elimination of Nazi tyranny over the oppressed peoples of Europe....  Dwight D. Eisenhower was the Supreme Commander of Allied forces. In preparation for the invasion, he crafted a statement for the general public in the event the landings failed. Explore this lesson and learn about how Eisenhower's actions exemplified the civic virtue of responsibility in leading the Allied forces.  https://bit.ly/4mEeoMR

In this recent episode of Moreland University Front of the Class, BRI's Senior Director of Civic Learning Initiatives, Rachel Davison Humphries shares how she came to embrace the concept of direct assistance  which eventually led her to enter education. She discusses teaching at Montessori schools, developing curricula in Guatemala, and helping students internalize the importance of civics through he position at the Bill of Rights Institute. Her story will connect with career changers and career teachers alike as she recounts transformative moments and highlights the importance of agency-driven education. Watch or listen today!  https://bit.ly/458g2QM
